question_bank.enervate: The long, humid hike began to _____ the group within an hour. By the end of the day, even lifting their backpacks felt exhausting.
question_bank.ingenuous: Her question was sincere and slightly naive, not calculated or manipulative. The interviewer found her _____.
question_bank.rancorous: After the betrayal, his messages were not just critical; they were openly _____. Even years later, he spoke with deep, lasting resentment.
question_bank.augmented: The navigation app _____ the live camera view with arrows and street names. The overlay added digital labels directly onto the real scene.
question_bank.diplomatic: During the tense negotiation, she avoided blame and chose neutral wording. Her _____ tone kept both sides willing to keep talking.
question_bank.sumptuous: They served a/an _____ dinner with rich sauces, fine linens, and elegant table settings. It felt luxuriously comfortable rather than wasteful or showy.
question_bank.domineering: He didn't just lead the discussion; he controlled it and cut off anyone who disagreed. His _____ manner made teammates hesitant to speak.
question_bank.fastidious: She is a/an _____ proofreader who notices a single misplaced comma immediately. Even minor formatting errors bother her.
question_bank.ingenuity: With no proper tools, he used a paperclip to repair the broken latch. The clever, practical workaround showed real _____.
question_bank.egotistical: He kept steering every topic back to his awards and demanded constant praise. The audience grew tired of his _____ attitude.
question_bank.equivocate: When asked whether he supported the plan, he refused to give a clear yes or no. Instead, he tried to _____ with vague, slippery phrasing.
question_bank.repudiate: After the scandal, the company moved quickly to _____ the fake report. They publicly rejected it as false and unauthorized.
question_bank.champion: Even when it was unpopular, she continued to _____ the policy in public hearings. She actively supported it and argued for it repeatedly.
question_bank.arduous: The rescue climb was _____, requiring hours of hard physical effort on steep ice. It was exhausting work, not merely intimidating.
question_bank.eradicate: Health officials launched a campaign to _____ the invasive insect from the island. Their goal was complete elimination, not just a reduction.
question_bank.convey: A well-designed chart can _____ a complex trend faster than a long paragraph. Readers can understand the pattern at a glance.
question_bank.prevalent: The infection is highly _____ across multiple wards in the hospital. It appears in many places so frequently that staff must watch for it everywhere.
question_bank.enlighten: The workshop aimed to _____ the public about how vaccines are tested and monitored. Afterward, attendees understood the science much more clearly.
question_bank.antagonism: Years of rivalry created strong _____ between the two research teams. Their hostility made cooperation nearly impossible.
question_bank.discriminating: A/an _____ judge can distinguish a truly strong argument from one that only sounds persuasive. She makes careful evaluations based on subtle differences.
question_bank.banal: The essay relied on _____ phrases and predictable clich√©s. Nothing in it felt fresh or original.
question_bank.pestilential: After the flood, a/an _____ odor rose from rotting debris and sewage. Officials warned residents to avoid the contaminated area.
question_bank.austere: The room was _____, with bare walls and almost no decoration. The simplicity reflected a strict, no-frills lifestyle.
question_bank.momentous: Signing the treaty was a/an _____ event that people in the region will remember for generations. Historians later described it as historic and unforgettable.
question_bank.bombastic: His speech used _____ language about destiny and glory, but it offered no concrete plan. The grand, inflated wording sounded impressive yet empty.
